result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan O Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 12/03/15 or civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan O Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryan O Smith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
COURT FILE NOT IN COURT.  Parties have reached a resolution and are prepared to proceed with plea and sentencing. 
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court sentences defendant to serve 17 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 17 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 12-03-2015 or civil judgment.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bryan O Smith in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Bryan O Smith in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($200.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 200.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. jks
Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. jks

Defendant Bryan O Smith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a jury trial date.   Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 46. jks

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.   Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 46. jks  Calendar call scheduled for 02-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM000515  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-01-15
Cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it.

Defendant Bryan O Smith in court.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned  to Br. 46  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/5/15 @ 1:30pm
